title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) – The record books will show a 114-100 victory for the Philadelphia 76ers over the Houston Rockets. But the history made on this night belongs solely to Allen Iverson.

In a stunning, virtuoso performance, Iverson dropped a career-high and franchise-record 44 points, single-handedly eviscerating the Rockets’ defense and carrying his team to a statement road win. From the opening tip, it was clear this was not just another game; it was the night "The Answer" arrived as a league-wide force.

Iverson was a blur of crossover dribbles and fearless forays into the lane, operating with an audacity that left defenders grasping at air. He was relentless, a scoring machine who poured in points from every conceivable angle. While the Rockets scrambled to contain him, his teammates feasted on the opportunities his gravity created. Theo Ratliff provided a stout 16 points and 12 rebounds, but he was a supporting actor in the Iverson show.

Houston, led by 23 points from Hakeem Olajuwon and 21 from Charles Barkley, had no counter. Every time they threatened to close the gap, Iverson had a response—a silky jumper, a acrobatic layup, a dagger three. He wasn't just scoring; he was demoralizing.

The final buzzer signaled more than a win; it signaled a coronation. Forty-four points. A new standard for a franchise with a rich history. On this night, one man was the entire story, and the NBA was put on notice: Allen Iverson was here, and he was must-see television.
